agent module¶

class agent.AgentClient(name, scenario_dir, env_port_number='5561', env_request_port_number='5562')[source]¶

Bases: NodeModule

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates and executes commands that are thread-sensitive but that must be performed before the simulation starts.

async broadcast_handler()[source]¶

Listens for broadcasts from the environment. Stops processes when simulation end-command is received.

async coroutines()[source]¶

Generic routine to be performed by module. May be modified to perform other coroutines. Must not return unless an exception is raised. If method returns or raises an unhandled exception, this module and its parent module will terminate.

async environment_message_submitter(msg: NodeToEnvironmentMessage, module_name: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

submitts a request of any type to the environment

async internal_message_handler(msg: InternalMessage)[source]¶

Handles message intended for this module and performs actions accordingly.

async live()[source]¶

MAIN FUNCTION executes event loop for ayncronous processes within the agent

async message_transmitter(msg: InterNodeMessage)[source]¶

transmits a message of any type to an agent

async network_config()[source]¶

Creates communication sockets and connects this agent to them.

‘environment_broadcast_socket’: listens for broadcasts coming from the environment ‘environment_request_socket’: used to request and receive information directly from the environment ‘agent_socket_in’: conects to other agents. Receives requests for information from others ‘agent_socket_out’: connects to other agents. Sends information to others

process_results()[source]¶
async run()[source]¶

Performs simulation actions.

Runs every module owned by the agent. Stops when one of the modules goes off-line, completes its run() routines, or the environment sends a simulation end broadcast.

async send_blanc_response()[source]¶
async sync_environment()[source]¶

Cend a synchronization request to environment server

async wait_sim_start()[source]¶

Awaits for simulation start message from the environment. This message contains a ledger that maps agent names to ports to be connected to for inter-agent communications. The message also contains information about the clock-type being used in this simulation.
